subject: statistics
title: Bootstrap Confidence Intervals
contentHtml:
The Bootstrap confidence interval is a non-parametric method for constructing confidence intervals without assuming normality or any specific distribution.

This approach is particularly useful when dealing with small sample sizes, outliers, or complex distributions.
name: Bootstrap Confidence Interval
problemHtml: Given a dataset of exam scores, construct a 95% confidence interval for the mean score using the Bootstrap method.

intuition: The Bootstrap method allows us to construct a confidence interval by repeatedly resampling from our original dataset and recalculating the statistic of interest.
realWorldApplications: Constructing confidence intervals for complex distributions in machine learning

title: Bootstrap Confidence Intervals
contentHtml:
Bootstrap confidence intervals provide a non-parametric way to estimate population parameters without assuming normality or equal variances.

This method is particularly useful when dealing with complex data distributions or small sample sizes.
